description:
Panicle (grain head)	Long, compact, fully emerged, free from discoloration
Grain color	Uniform and developing well, not chaffy or shriveled
Leaves	Still green on the lower half (not completely dried up)
Plant Structure	Upright and strong stems holding up the panicle

Expand into elliptical or diamond-shaped spots with gray centers and brown or reddish borders; Node area turns black or brown
Stem may break or collapse
Grain filling is affected or completely fails
Possible Steps:
Use Resistant Varieties
Step: Plant blast-resistant millet varietiesFungicide Application
Step: Use appropriate fungicides when blast symptoms are first noticed. Optimize Planting Density
Step: Avoid overcrowding millet plants by spacing them properly.

description:
Small, round or oval raised spots on the leaf surface
Color: Rusty reddish-brown to dark brown
Appear in clusters or rows, often on both sides of the leaves
Spots may later burst open and release powdery spores
Possible Steps:
Plant Resistant Varieties. Optimize Planting Density and Spacing
Step: Reduce plant density by ensuring appropriate spacing between plants.
Step: Use rust-resistant millet varieties.Fungicide Application
Step: Apply fungicides early and throughout the growing season.
